People: Hong Xiuquan, Li Xiucheng, Zeng Guofan
Significance: Imperial China reorganized & strengthened; breakdown of Confucian social order
Causes: Millennium-long Confucian backlash; thousands of refugees trying to escape decadence
Consequences: Chinese imperial government ruthlessly suppressing rebellions, resulting in millions of deaths; Social and religious changes that would later contribute to Communism
Opposing Sides: Qing dynasty forces vs. Taiping Heavenly Kingdom forces
